body:
Hi there , i hope everything is going fine for you .

I'd like to ask a question about {{champion:266}} : 

As an avid Aatrox player (M7 and 280K MP) i'm really , reaaaalllyy curious about his GU . Is there a possibility to share just a little tiny bit of information about it ?

replies.body: Hey, dude! So I can't really get into specifics about Aatrox's current state, but we're for sure working on him and a lot of the stuff I've played with is fun! He's not really my sort of character (I main Cass/Aurelion Sol) so I personally haven't played him, but we've been getting him in our playtests quite a bit so I've faced off against him and have had him on my team. The main playtester for Aatrox is Riot Novalas and the designer is Riot Jag - he made Camille!

I really want to tease you about adcs after Penguin and Novalas comments in dev cornor. Will endeavor to resist that urge and instead I'm gonna say thank you. Seen ya in a few posts across the boards today and a lot of us players enjoy chatting with reds about the game so much obliged for your time.  ( Seriously thou how does jinx fair vs Swain and Aatrox?)

My ADC is legendary, I swear!  Actually though, it's become something of a meme in the Playtest Pit because of one particular game. We load into the playtest, my support and I run bot lane (I'm playing Kalista), I declare to my support "I like to play aggressive, I hope you do too" and then proceed to get killed Level 1 without using any summs. It was completely tragic and my team went up in flames and now I get a bunch of shit whenever I'm marksman. For sure at least one person makes the "He likes to play aggressive and he hopes you do too" comment whenever I get filled as AD in our tests. >_>


To actually answer your question, Jinx probably does well against both of them because of her range although I think if either of them get on top of her she's going to have a REALLY bad time.

Guess you werent used to taking minion damage at level 1 iykwim?

{{sticker:sg-ezreal}}
{{sticker:cass-cry}}

"the designer is Riot Jag - he made Camille!"

Oh. 

This makes me excited and happy I saved my Mecha Aatrox shard. I'm not a melee fighter player but Cami easily became one of my favorite champions lore-wise and for game play.

P.S Is a playtester exactly as the name suggests, you play for work?

Somewhat! Our core responsibility is indeed to play the game with in-development changes and then acting as feedback providers/consultants for designers. The team is still relatively young so we're still figuring out how far we can reach with what we can do, but everyone on the team is really outgoing and often takes on additional responsibilities / projects. It's not uncommon at all for us to actually pitch abilities and balance changes to designers. Some examples of some other stuff we've done: One of the playtesters is a ref for LCS. I've personally done some design explorations on Aurelion Sol with one of the champion designers and helped out in a number of our player labs. Another playtester helped make the champion spotlights for Kayn, Ornn, and Urgot! We're all super passionate about League (obviously since we've all spent thousands and thousands of hours playing) and are constantly looking for ways to get more involved in the process of making the game as great as it can be. :)

wassup man, you're the guy that only played cassio on high elo streams, right ? I'm really curious about working at riot, not that I ever will, I live on another continent, but how did you get the job ? applied right after college ? seems like a dream job.

Yeah that's me! :) 

Honestly, I sort of stumbled upon my job at Riot. When I finished my bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering I decided to go all the way for a doctorate degree and moved to Boston. While I was living in Boston I saw that Riot was in town doing recruiting at the local colleges for their internship program and they were hosting a Worlds viewing party at a bar near where I lived. Having no friends in the city, I thought it would be a great opportunity to meet people with similar interests as me (League) and so I went. At the bar I met Riot August - the champion designer of Gnar, Ekko, Jinx, Vi, and Jhin and we became friends. He reached out to me and encouraged me to apply! I spent some time thinking about it and then decided I'd give it a shot - at that point I realized I didn't want to commit 5 years for a doctorate degree and opted to finish with a master's. So I got my master's in Structural Engineering, applied to Riot, and got rejected! I moved back home and worked as an engineer for a year. August reached out to me again and told me I should apply once more - this time I prepared (watched a ton of youtube videos about game design), went through the interview process, and lo and behold I got the job! Moved out here in February - it has for sure proven to be the best decision I've ever made. :D

Working at Riot sounds super awesome. What would you recommend for a young and budding person wanting to find a position at Riot? What do you guys primarily look for in a hire?

I guess a starting point would be trying to have some sort of understanding of what you want to do. Our website has a careers page with current openings here: [Riot Games Careers](https://www.riotgames.com/en/work-with-us/welcome)

Without knowing your particular interests, I would say the best thing you could do is find something you're passionate about and dive into it. For example, if you were interested in being an engineer here, I'd spend a lot of time learning about code, come up with and working on my own individual projects, and really trying my best to connect with other people who share the same passion.

I did this when I was a civil engineer. I got myself really involved in various CE clubs in college, did extracurricular research and helped out professors with their work whenever I could, and attended as many conferences, meetings, etc. with other engineers in the area as possible. It's a lot of work, but I was really passionate about what I did that drive is what ultimately took me to Boston to get my graduate degree. Riot, in my personal opinion, loves people who are willing to push themselves outside of their comfort zone, aren't afraid of failure, are curious and have a desire to level themselves up and the people around them, and of course, are passionate about gaming!

Hi King Cobra!

I'm not an Aatrox player myself but I've been following discussion around him with interest. One thing I was wondering: mechanically, Aatrox is fairly simple (i'd say he's quite straightforward). Will his new kit be similarly easy, or is his complexity going up?

Since your limited, I understand details are pretty much prohibited, But I'm gonna list off as much info as I know and hopefully you can answer yes or no to some of them.

Aatrox is having every single ability altered in some way

This is only a GU, so he's going to appear the same in game

With abilities being altered though, we can expect new animations where it is warranted

Lore will be altered to reflect new gameplay (and as a result, other champion lores too)

Aatrox is the name of the Darkin that was trapped in the sword (possibly still trapped, just possessing the body of the current wielder?)

Aatrox getting a new Voice Over

Since Aatrox is getting a new Voice Over, the direction of his kit is, for the most part, complete and finished (going to assume certain ability ratios are up for change, but the abilities themselves are pretty much finished)

I'd list of a few more things, but they're mostly just speculation without anything to back them up and too niche of questions to warrant an answer. Any answers to these questions would be appreciated, even if only one. Thankyou
